sys_hub_action_type_definition.copied_from_name: Copy of Add Job To View
sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
This action adds a job to the view on the Jenkins server.

Inputs:

  • View Path - Provide full path of the view. E.g. snow/development/Releases.
    • If the view 'Releases' is on the top level then view path will be 'Releases'.
    • If the view 'Releases' is under 'snow/development' folder then view path will be 'snow/development/Releases'.
  • Job Path - Name of the job that needs to added in the view. If the job is under subfolders then provide path to the job . E.g. 'Jpetstore_v1.0' or 'Prova/Eden'.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • View path doesn't exists/inaccessible or view type is not list view.
  • The value provided for either View Path or Job Path is invalid.
  • Job path doesn't exists or not accessible.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • The Jenkins server is being restarted.
  • You do not have enough permissions to perform this action in Jenkins server.
  • The value provided for either View Path or Job Path is invalid.

Additional Notes:

  • Make sure that the provided view type is list view.
  • For Jobs which are under subfolders ensure that Recurse in subfolders property needs to be enabled.

To use this action, the corresponding Jenkins connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jenkins Connection & Credential alias.

Disclaimer:Jenkins and Jenkins logo are a registered trademark of Jenkins.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.description:
This action adds a job to the view on the Jenkins server.

Inputs:

  • View Path - Provide full path of the view. E.g. snow/development/Releases.
    • If the view 'Releases' is on the top level then view path will be 'Releases'.
    • If the view 'Releases' is under 'snow/development' folder then view path will be 'snow/development/Releases'.
  • Job Path - Name of the job that needs to added in the view. If the job is under subfolders then provide path to the job . E.g. 'Jpetstore_v1.0' or 'Prova/Eden'.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • View path doesn't exists/inaccessible or view type is not list view.
  • The value provided for either View Path or Job Path is invalid.
  • Job path doesn't exists or not accessible.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • The Jenkins server is being restarted.
  • You do not have enough permissions to perform this action in Jenkins server.
  • The value provided for either View Path or Job Path is invalid.

Additional Notes:

  • Make sure that the provided view type is list view.
  • For Jobs which are under subfolders ensure that Recurse in subfolders property needs to be enabled.

To use this action, the corresponding Jenkins connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jenkins Connection & Credential alias.

Disclaimer:Jenkins and Jenkins logo are a registered trademark of Jenkins.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
